thread.title: Solveforce Begins Offering Cable Service Provider Reputation Services to Columbus, Ohio
thread.title_full: Solveforce Begins Offering Cable Service Provider Reputation Services to Columbus, Ohio

author: Ron Legarski
title: Solveforce Begins Offering Cable Service Provider Reputation Services to Columbus, Ohio
text:
Solveforce's real-time online Cable Service Provider ( http://cable.serviceproviders.biz/ ) tool will reveal the true provider network to Columbus residents, along with Better Business Bureau credentials, when available. Cable vs Satellite
Cable and satellite TV are different in more ways than just how they deliver television programming. Cable TV is less likely to be affected by the weather, but is typically more expensive than satellite TV service. Cable may be more suitable for renters and people who do not want to commit to a long-term contract. Satellite TV signal can be disrupted by bad weather, but is usually cheaper.
The availability for cable and satellite TV services also varies; cable TV is only available in areas where providers offer service (which sometimes excludes rural areas or new communities in the suburbs), while satellite TV is available anywhere that a dish can be installed to face south. Solveforce will help with these tough decisions in choosing the best cable service provider ( http://cable.bandwidth.us.com/ ).
Cable TV rarely loses reception, unless the entire system goes down or the cable lines are severed somewhere along their route into the home. Satellite TV gets clear reception only when there is nothing between the satellite dish and the southern sky. Anything that stands in the way - a tree, building, wires, even heavy rain can interrupt service.
Sometimes, moving the dish even slightly can interrupt the precise alignment of a dish and can affect reception. A securely mounted dish with good exposure to the southern sky will rarely have bad reception, other than during bad weather, where it can become fuzzy or lose signal completely, but will be back as soon as it passes.
